intro: Lygeum tenax, commonly known as the common lygeum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lygeum tenax is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and rocky soils.
